title: Disturbing Posters Of Alleged Bondi Shooter Pop Up In Melbourne | 10 News
description: At least 40 disturbing images depicting alleged Bondi terror attack gunman Naveed Akram have been plastered across Melbourne, mimicking the street art series titled “Aussie”.  The city council is scrambling to remove the posters which are believed to have been put up on the Australia Day long weekend. title: Polar Bears Growing Bigger & Healthier Despite Thinning Sea Ice | 10 News
description: Scientists have revealed polar bears are growing fatter and healthier despite thinning sea ice.  The researchers are considering a theory that the bears have adapted to hunting land-based prey previously over-hunted by humans.  10’s Late News explains. title: Alleged Ransom Note Demands Millions For Savannah Guthrie’s Mother | 10 News
description: An alleged ransom letter for the 84-year-old mother of US journalist and television host Savannah Guthrie has surfaced, demanding a hefty sum in Bitcoin.  American tabloid TMZ reported that it received an unverified ransom note regarding the whereabouts of Nancy Guthrie and requesting an amount in the millions with demands that the funds be sent to a specific Bitcoin address.  Investigators have also stated they believe Nancy was abducted after she vanished from her home in Arizona and was reported missing over the weekend.  Pima County Sheriff Chris Nanos said during a press conference, "We do believe that Nancy was taken from her home against her will, and that's where we're at." title: Prince Edward Breaks Royal Family’s Silence Over Epstein Files | 10 News
description: Prince Edward has broken the Royal Family’s silence after emails and photos involving Sarah Ferguson and Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor were released as part of the Epstein files this weekend.  The Duke of Edinburgh said it is "really important always to remember the victims" and “a lot of victims in this”, during a panel at the World Governments Forum in Dubai  The US Justice Department published new files related to Epstein on Friday which included emails that showed Edward's older brother Andrew maintaining regular contact with Epstein for more than two years after he was found guilty of child sex crimes. description: Prince Edward has broken the Royal Family’s silence after emails and photos involving Sarah Ferguson and Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor were released as part of the Epstein files this weekend. title: Spain Proposes Social Media Ban For Teens | 10 News
description: The Spanish government is looking to implement a ban on social media use for teenagers under the age of 16-years-old, inline with Australian laws.  Other European nations are reportedly considering the ban, including Greece, Britain and France.  Advocates for the laws in Spain say the rules will help parents set clear limits, and attempt to negate the negative affects of social media on their children.
